descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributors stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases experienced contributors by promoting new contributors who gain proficiency.
The promotion rate flow increases experienced contributors by transitioning them from the new contributor pool.
The promotion rate flow increases core developers by promoting qualified experienced contributors.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill up by providing hands-on mentorship and guidance.
Implicit knowledge transfer increases the promotion rate by preparing contributors for more advanced roles.
More core developers increase implicit knowledge transfer capacity through mentorship and code review.
Explicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill up by providing accessible documentation and learning resources.
The colored stock represents the potential contributor pool that feeds into new contributors.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the skill up flow as more individuals undergo training.
A larger core developer team can increase turnover due to burnout or career progression.
More experienced contributors increase the promotion rate as a larger candidate pool is eligible for core roles.
